item.title: Join in! Merging Data Frames in R (Part 1)
item.description: code.sourceCode span { display: inline-block; line-height: 1.25; } code.sourceCode span { color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit; } code.sourceCode span:empty { height: 1.2em; } .sourceCode { overflow: visible; } code.sourceCode { white-space: pre; position: relative; } div.sourceCode { margin: 1em 0; } pre.sourceCode { margin: 0; } @media screen { div.sourceCode { overflow: auto; } } @media print { code.sourceCode { white-space: pre-wrap; } code.sourceCode span { text-indent: -5em; padding-left: 5em; } } pre.

item.title: Life Expectancy - Time Series Clustering
item.description: Image by Alexas_Fotos from Pixabay Life Expectancy in different countries In this article, we want to take a look at time-series clustering. Great time-series data can be acquired with the WorldBank-API. For starters, we will query the life-expectancy for men and women from all available countries. In a next step, we calculate the average life-expectancy as: \[LE_{avg} = \frac{LE_{men} + LE_{women}}{2} \]. Note that this does not take different populations of men and women into account, they are weighted equally.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
